intro: Midweek briefing: company moves and product decisions led the cycle. It leans builder-first, with concrete things to test quickly. We reviewed 25+ sources so you do not have to.

briefing.title: ChatGPT’s deep research tool adds a built-in document viewer so you can read its reports
briefing.note: OpenAI is updating ChatGPT's deep research tool with a full-screen viewer that you can use to scroll through and navigate to specific areas. Why it matters: As shown in a video shared by OpenAI, the built-in viewer allows you to open ChatGPT's reports in a window.

articles.title: The two patterns by which agents connect sandboxes
articles.summary: Thank you to Nuno Campos from Witan Labs, Tomas Beran and Mikayel Harutyunyan from E2B, Jonathan Wall from Runloop, and Ben Guo from Zo Computer for their review and comments. TL;DR: More and more agents need a workspace: a computer where they can run code, install packages, and access.

sections.title: Ship-It Playbooks
sections.deck: Practical implementation guides you can adapt quickly.

articles.title: NVIDIA Researchers Introduce KVTC Transform Coding Pipeline to Compress Key-Value Caches by 20x for Efficient LLM Serving
articles.summary: Serving Large Language Models (LLMs) at scale is a massive engineering challenge because of Key-Value (KV) cache management. As models grow in size and reasoning capability, the KV cache footprint increases and becomes a major bottleneck for throughput and latency. For modern Transformers, this cache can occupy multiple gigabytes.
articles.what_happened: Serving Large Language Models (LLMs) at scale is a massive engineering challenge because of Key-Value (KV) cache management.
articles.why_it_matters: As models grow in size and reasoning capability, the KV cache footprint increases and becomes a major bottleneck for throughput and latency.
articles.what_to_do: Reuse one implementation step in your stack and document what changed.
articles.our_take: Shipping signal: As models grow in size and reasoning capability, the KV cache footprint increases and becomes a major bottleneck for throughput and latency.

articles.title: GPU as a Service Pricing: A Complete Guide to Cost Models and Savings
articles.summary: In the fast-evolving world of cloud computing, GPU-as-a-service has become essential for handling intensive tasks such as AI training, machine learning inference, scientific simulations, and graphics rendering. Businesses and developers increasingly turn to these on-demand resources to avoid the high upfront costs of purchasing hardware.
